main event: A shiny silver round object was observed in the sky near Colorado Springs, CO, on May 25, 1952.
interesting points: The object had no apparent aerodynamic features such as wings or tail., It was observed at a high altitude of 22,000 feet., The sighting lasted for approximately one minute., The object moved quickly and disappeared into a cloud bank., The observer was located approximately 12 miles east of Trenton Air Force Base.
witness description: The observer was located approximately 12 miles east of Trenton Air Force Base and viewed the object at a distance.
